Gerd

what is Gerd?

The reflux of stomach acid back into your esophagus is called gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). Acid reflux can cause irritation of the esophageal lining. Acid reflux is common among many people. Acid reflux with mild symptoms occurs at least twice a week, and moderate to severe symptoms occur at least once a week.
Many people can manage the discomfort of GERD by changing their lifestyles and taking over-the-counter medications. However, strong medications may be required for those with severe symptoms.

Symptoms?

The following symptoms are common to GERD:

  • Usually, after eating, heartburn (burning in the chest) may be worse at night
  • Chest pain
  • Swallowing problems
  • sour liquids or food regurgitation
  • The sensation of a lump in your throat

Personalized Everything

There is No One Diet For Everyone

Vegetables: The natural fat and sugar content of vegetables is low. Leafy greens, potatoes, cucumbers, and green beans are also good options
Ginger: As a natural remedy for heartburn and gastrointestinal disorders, ginger offers anti-inflammatory properties.
Oatmeal: A favorite breakfast cereal, oatmeal is a whole grain that is high in fiber.
Non-citrus fruits: Non-citrus fruits, such as melons, bananas, apples, and pears, have fewer chances of triggering reflux symptoms than acidic fruits.

Why Vedas Cure GERD treatment is right for you?

Vedas Cure GERD treatment is one of the best treatments for GERD in India. This treatment has already Treated thousands of patients till now. Vedas Cure GERD medicines are made up of herbal composition and are 100% natural. GERD medicines are GERD Reflux Care and Gasto 21 

GERD Reflux Care contains herbs like Mukta Shukti Pishti, Chirayata, Nimbu Satva, etc. These herbs help to treat acidity and heartburn problems which is the main reason for GERD. Gasto 21  contains herbs like Gulab Phool, Saunf, Siloy Satva, etc. These herbs helps to reduce gas problems.

excerpt.rendered: Gerd what is Gerd? The reflux of stomach acid back into your esophagus is called gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). Acid reflux can cause irritation of the esophageal lining. Acid reflux is common among many people. Acid reflux with mild symptoms occurs at least twice a week, and moderate to severe symptoms occur at least once […]
